p: The effects of A. sylvaticus on the side effects of chemotherapy in cancer patients were also investigated by Valadares et al. [ 89] in a randomized, double-blind, placebo-controlled trial of 46 women with breast cancer administered 2.1 g/d of the extract for 6 months. Again, there was an improvement in the patientsâ€™ condition in various respects, such as pain, appetite, and bowel function, with a very low rate of the occurrence of certain side effects compared to the placebo group.
